definitions.definition: The amount of space between two points, usually geographical points, usually (but not necessarily) measured along a straight line.
definitions.example: From Moscow, the distance is relatively short to Saint Petersburg, relatively long to Novosibirsk, but even greater to Vladivostok.

definitions.definition: The difference; the subjective measure between two quantities.
definitions.example: We're narrowing the distance between the two versions of the bill.  The distance between the lowest and next gear on my bicycle is annoying.

definitions.definition: Remoteness of place; a remote place.

definitions.example: the distance between a descendant and his ancestor

definitions.definition: A space marked out in the last part of a racecourse.
The entire amount of progress to an objective.
definitions.example: He had promised to perform this task, but did not go the distance.

definitions.definition: A withholding of intimacy; alienation; variance.
definitions.example: The friendship did not survive the row: they kept each other at a distance.

definitions.definition: The remoteness or reserve which respect requires; hence, respect; ceremoniousness.
The space measured back from the winning-post which a racehorse running in a heat must reach when the winner has covered the whole course, in order to run in the final heat.
To move away (from) someone or something.
definitions.example: He distanced himself from the comments made by some of his colleagues.

definitions.definition: To leave at a distance; to outpace, leave behind.
